content:
本件保存
會員委設建庫 水門 石 SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
+
SDC - 5108
May 12, 1962
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Subject:
GSA Surplus Equipment
Dear Mr. Li:
Reference is made to the copy of the telegram from Mr. D. E. Thornton GPRD AID Representative, San Francisco, California to AID/M dated May 4, 1962 advising 100 each engines complete, Model 270 GMC 6 cylinder, cond. E-2, AACQ. are available and packed ready for shipment. Refer to AAENIY report A-140-62-6-2043. Copy of the telegram is returned herewith.
According to MKA recommendation, 30 (thirty) each of the above engines are required by the Shilmen Project, because the same type of engine is used for our flat bed and cargo trucks. We, therefore, request your immediate arrangement with AID/M to allocate these equipment for meeting our present requirements.
Your action on this matter will be highly appreciated. Very truly yours,
y 72 NFS
Enclosure cc: Mr. J. B. Carter, AID/M Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA
SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
W.11.1Km W. K. Ku Chief Engineer
51.5. 15 09588 V.C.
s a. 15h
(2)
$
Ntm
CUSA
408
國史饭 Academia Historica

Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan

Reference is made to the copy of the telegram from Mr. D. E. Thornton GPRD AID Representative, San Francisco, California to AID/M dated May 4, 1962 advising 100 each engines complete, Model 270 GMC 6 cylinder, cond. E-2, AACQ. are available and packed ready for shipment. Refer to AAENIY report A-140-62-6-2043. Copy of the telegram is returned herewith.

According to MKA recommendation, 30 (thirty) each of the above engines are required by the Shilmen Project, because the same type of engine is used for our flat bed and cargo trucks. We, therefore, request your immediate arrangement with AID/M to allocate these equipment for meeting our present requirements.
Your action on this matter will be highly appreciated. Very truly yours,
